column4: when enabling write support for my ntfs drives using ntfs-config i get the error "volume is scheduled for check.  Please boot into windows...blah blah"..........my problem is that i dont have windows installed....how do i fix this?
prisonel: i use ndiswrapper to get my wireless working and in linux it sees more wireless spots than when i'm in windows (on my laptop)
Could you help me setup my card? Im not sure how to begin..I checked on the forum and there're too many different ways of doing it, and I'm afraid I'll mess up everything
